title: Ask HN: How much productivity do you think is lost by sitting vs. standing?
text:
Spent the last 3 years in home office where I have a standing desk setup. Came into a coworking space today with no standing desks. Feel like I’m half asleep. I can’t be any more than 50-60% as productive as when I was standing!

Crazy that we know sitting is bad for you. How much productivity change, if any, have you felt if you’ve tried switching to stand up work?

Also, what an easy win for a lot of companies, if productivity changes 10-20% plus on standing desks, what an incredible easy boost that is.

Show HN: Hetzner-k3s v1.0.1 is out with autoscaling support
text:
This is the newest update to my CLI tool to quickly create cheap Kubernetes clusters in Hetzner Cloud.

This update adds autoscaling support, so clusters created with this tool now can behave similar to managed Kubernetes clusters, which I think is awesome.

I received a lot of feedback since the last update so I hope anyone interested could try the new version as well.

Thanks a lot for the feedback so far!

The repo: https://github.com/vitobotta/hetzner-k3s

I found a correlation between chess rating and depression
text:
I'm not sure if I'm totally correct but that's a fun fact.

I suffer from mood ups and downs, and but everyday (usually when I eat) I play blitz.

The thing is that the rating that I have, quite a lot depends on my mood. Which is maybe obvious, but I can see it on this chart:

https://share.cleanshot.com/480sYN5Z

By this chart it's possible to understand my mood, concentration, cognitive things and all that.

When the rating swing in a range +- 50 it's okay, but when you loose 200 points it's usually due to something wrong with you. For me it's certainly depression.

That's it, just a random fact that probably true. Probably not. Not scientific. But recently I coulnd't get from 1730 to my previous 1900+ for weeks, loosing all the time
